ygData.subject: Re: Weight
ygData.msgSnippet: I do not play a monk so i dont know from experience, but what i was told by a higher lvl monk friend is that at the early lvls weight doesnt matter all that
ygData.messageBody:
I do not play a monk so i dont know from experience, but what i was told by a higher lvl monk friend is that at the early lvls weight doesnt matter all that much but at higher lvls anything above 15 weight takes off 3AC per weight...perhaps a higher lvl monk on this list can confirm this.

-----Original Message-----
From: Blizzard <blizzard15@...>
To: EQ_Monk@onelist.com <EQ_Monk@onelist.com>; EQ-Monks@onelist.com <EQ-Monks@onelist.com>
Date: Sunday, July 04, 1999 12:01 PM
Subject: [EQ-Monks] Weight


I have heard many people say that weight affects my ac, then I have also heard many that say that weight affects my chance of hitting. I was just starting to get rid of my leather armor for light patchwork or maybe just spend all my money on netted when I saw a monk wearing leather. When I asked him he said that weight doesn't matter at all for monks. Now, I usually have more weight than 14 and I find myself missing more then my other less bulbous monk counterparts. So, what's the truth does weight matter for us?

I also was wondering, does ac and atk mean the damage we take and do, or the chance we have to get hit or hit. Thanks for your time all.

-Blizzard
